articles.description: Follow live radio commentary and text updates as host nation France play New Zealand in the opening game of the World Cup.
articles.title: Rugby World Cup: France v New Zealand opening ceremony – radio & text

articles.description: Listen to Sportsound coverage and follow live text commentary as Scotland seek a fifth win out of five in Euro 2024 qualifying against Cyprus in Larnaca.
articles.title: Euro 2024 qualifying: Cyprus v Scotland build-up

articles.description: 23-time Grand Slam champion Novak Djokovic faces home hope Ben Shelton for a place in the US Open final - follow live.
articles.title: US Open: Djokovic v Shelton for place in final - radio & text

articles.description: Devon Conway and Daryl Mitchell score unbeaten centuries as New Zealand comfortably win the first one-day international against England in Cardiff.
articles.title: England thrashed by New Zealand in opening ODI

articles.description: England seek to put aside their turbulent build-up by beating Argentina in their opening World Cup match on Saturday, writes rugby correspondent Chris Jones.
articles.title: Pressure on England to perform in World Cup opener

articles.description: Devon Conway and Daryl Mitchell both hit hundreds as New Zealand beat England by eight wickets in the first ODI in Cardiff.
articles.title: New Zealand ease past England in first ODI

articles.description: Barcelona teenager Lamine Yamal becomes the youngest player and goalscorer for the Spanish national team in a thumping Euro 2024 qualifier win against Georgia.
articles.title: Yamal becomes Spain's youngest player and scorer

articles.description: Britain's Laura Muir follows up last month's 800m Diamond League win with victory in the 1500m in Brussels.
articles.title: Muir claims second straight Diamond League win

articles.description: Red Bull motorsport adviser Helmut Marko apologises for blaming Sergio Perez's inconsistent form this season on his ethnicity.
articles.title: Marko apologises to Perez over 'offensive remark'

articles.description: Former England captain Andrew Flintoff is pictured for the first time since he was injured in an accident while filming Top Gear in last year.
articles.title: Flintoff pictured for first time since Top Gear crash
